name: stress_integration

elevated.notes: Signals are amplified and routed more aggressively toward D1 + conflict motives.

reactive.notes: Internal conflicts become dominant drivers of interpretation.

overload.notes: Interpretation engine gives priority to emotional processing and identity destabilization.

threat_sensitivity.notes: Stress increases reliance on abandonment + betrayal motives.

motive_conflict_priority.notes: Conflict motives dominate when stress reaches reactive state.

affect_override.notes: Emotional volatility or shutdown patterns control interpretation.

vector_bias_method.description: Bias is multiplicative. Example: vector = vector * bias_factor.

stress_progression.description: If a signal elevates stress beyond one threshold, the engine automatically checks for the next threshold without resetting.
stress_progression.notes: Allows realistic stress stacking and de-escalation.

stress_recovery.description: Stress gradually decreases between cycles. Interpretation bias fades accordingly.

notes: Integrates stress levels with interpretation biases, vector amplification, and conflict weighting. This module determines how the engine shifts under pressure.
